title: Vectors Comprehensive Quiz
description: Comprehensive quiz covering vector operations, products, geometry, and applications in 3D space.

questions.question: What is the result of adding vectors a = (3, -2, 5) and b = (1, 4, -1)?
questions.explanation: Vector addition is performed component-wise: (3+1, -2+4, 5+(-1)) = (4, 2, 4)

questions.question: What is the dot product of vectors u = (2, -1, 4) and v = (1, 3, 2)?
What is the cross product of vectors p = (1, 2, 3) and q = (4, 5, 6)?
What does the scalar triple product a·(b×c) represent geometrically?
options: Area of the parallelogram formed by b and c
Volume of the parallelepiped formed by a, b, and c
Angle between vectors a and b
Distance between points a and b
questions.explanation: The scalar triple product gives the volume of the parallelepiped formed by the three vectors.

questions.question: When are two vectors perpendicular?
options: When their cross product is zero
When their dot product is zero
When they have the same magnitude
questions.explanation: Two vectors are perpendicular when their dot product equals zero.

questions.question: When are two vectors collinear?
options: When their dot product is zero
When their cross product is zero
When they have the same direction
questions.explanation: Two vectors are collinear when their cross product is the zero vector.

questions.question: When are three vectors coplanar?
options: When their scalar triple product is zero
When their dot products are all zero
When they are all unit vectors
When they form a right triangle
questions.explanation: Three vectors are coplanar when their scalar triple product equals zero.

questions.question: What is the relationship between direction cosines of a vector?
questions.explanation: The squares of the direction cosines always sum to 1: cos²α + cos²β + cos²γ = 1

questions.question: What is the vector equation of a line passing through point a with direction vector b?
questions.explanation: The vector equation of a line is r = a + t b, where a is a point on the line and b is the direction vector.

questions.question: What is the general equation of a plane?
questions.explanation: The general equation of a plane is ax + by + cz + d = 0, where (a,b,c) is the normal vector.

questions.question: How do you find the angle between two planes?
options: Using the dot product of their normal vectors
Using the cross product of their normal vectors
Using the distance between the planes
Using the intersection line of the planes
questions.explanation: The angle between two planes is found using the dot product of their normal vectors.

questions.question: What type of curve is represented by the equation x² + y² - 4x + 2y + 1 = 0?
questions.explanation: Completing the square: (x-2)² + (y+1)² = 4, which is a circle with center (2,-1) and radius 2.

questions.question: What is the area of the parallelogram formed by vectors a = (1,2,3) and b = (4,5,6)?
questions.explanation: The area of the parallelogram is equal to the magnitude of the cross product |a × b|.

questions.question: What is the volume of the tetrahedron formed by vectors a, b, and c?
questions.explanation: The volume of the tetrahedron is ⅙ times the absolute value of the scalar triple product |a · (b × c)|.

questions.question: Which property does NOT hold for the cross product?
questions.explanation: The cross product is not associative: (a × b) × c ≠ a × (b × c) in general.

questions.question: What is the Cartesian form of the line equation: r = (1,2,3) + t(2,1,-1)?
questions.explanation: The Cartesian form is (x-1)/2 = (y-2)/1 = (z-3)/(-1), where the denominators are the direction ratios.

questions.question: What is the distance from point (1,1,1) to the plane x + y + z - 3 = 0?
questions.explanation: Distance = |1+1+1-3|/√(1+1+1) = |0|/√3 = 0. The point lies on the plane.

questions.question: What does the equation x² = 4ay represent?
questions.explanation: x² = 4ay is the equation of a parabola opening upwards along the y-axis.

questions.question: If vectors a and b are perpendicular, what is a · b?
questions.explanation: Perpendicular vectors have a dot product of zero.

questions.question: What is the direction cosine of the x-component of vector (1,2,3)?
questions.explanation: Direction cosine for x: cosα = x/|v| = 1/√(1+4+9) = 1/√14
